dt.t: In the month of August 1994, Democrats remained {wi}sanguine{/wi} about their chances at the polls …
A lot of attention also is being devoted to the development of vaccines to prevent genital herpes, although not everyone is {wi}sanguine{/wi} about the outcome.

dt.t: … the radiant heat from the cedar logs, whose {wi}sanguine{/wi} colour made the silvered locks of his hair into a fantastic wreath of flames.
… some {wi}sanguine{/wi} vessels are obstructed, and distended …
… attacked by the {wi}sanguine{/wi} … warriors of neighboring islands …

dt: {bc}accompanied by, involving, or relating to bloodshed {bc}{sx|bloody||}

dt.t: … from the numerous graves, including those by the barn, which our shells had destroyed; we realized what a {wi}sanguine{/wi} battle it had been …
She was all unnerved; her naturally {wi}sanguine{/wi} complexion was pale …

dt: {bc}having blood as the predominating bodily humor {dx}see {dxt|humor:1||2c}{/dx}

dt.t: An abundance of red blood was marked by a warm and {wi}sanguine{/wi} temperament; whereas, an excess of yellow bile produced the choleric temperament …

dt: {bc}having the bodily {d_link|conformation|conformation} and temperament held characteristic of such predominance and marked by sturdiness, healthy red complexion, and cheerfulness

dt.t: He conceived himself rather as a {wi}sanguine{/wi} and strenuous man, a great fighter.

quotes.t: He has been strangely {qword}sanguine{/qword} about this, blandly ignoring the mounting evidence that dissident elements in the police are stirring trouble …

How could a man of his caliber be this {qword}sanguine{/qword} about a war we had barely begun to fight? He gave me the McNamara look, eyes focusing boldly through rimless glasses. "Every quantitative measurement we have shows that we're winning this war," he said.

He does not pretend to be {qword}sanguine{/qword} about our prospects. History itself, he reminds us, provides few examples of cultures as debilitated as ours which were not destroyed by the very forces they set in motion.
Yet if there were {qword}sanguine{/qword} expectations of war profits and unlimited booty from the Spanish empire, … those hopes were dramatically confounded …

et: Middle English {it}sanguin{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}sanguineus{/it}, from {it}sanguin-, sanguis{/it} {dx_ety}see {dxt|sanguinary||}{/dx_ety}
shortdef: marked by eager hopefulness : confidently optimistic
consisting of or relating to blood
